tsucJ3_i0HX5vwHl4jTzTA.review_text: As a big fan of craft beer, I was excited about this place months before it even opened. Obviously my expectations were high, but fortunately for me this place met - nay - EXCEEDED them.  Liquid Gold not only has excellent selection of local beers on tap, but they have several fridges of tall boys to buy and carry out OR enjoy right there at the bar (with corkage fees of course). Many of the beers I saw in the fridges I have never seen elsewhere too, which gives this place some serious points.  If you like City Beer Store, then you'll enjoy this place as well. CBS may have a larger selection of purchasable beers, but Liquid Gold has a better draft line in my opinion. Also, pound for pound (drop for drop?) I think LG has a better selection of beer given their space.  Finally, the owner, Tim, seems like a very genuine guy. He's always been exceedingly friendly, helpful and very willing to bring in beer that you want to see on his shelves. He's a local boy, too, so you know he's got his finger on the pulse of the beer industry of the area.  Final word: Liquid Gold is exactly what this neighborhood needed!

S2aLqy_qUspI2vN5HPXEZg.review_text: Nice new Taproom that i was able to enjoy a quick beer at while waiting for my friend to run an errand.  Looked like a great place to hangout and watch a game etc...   Not to much to it though.  Seats, Bar and Beer.   Will update again when i get to visit again.

aS_gPmw4cpHMItVYov8cqg.review_text: This has now become my favorite place in the city to grab a drink. The staff is friendly and well versed about the beer they carry. I love that all the beers are local brews and the ambiance pays homage to San Francisco.  The best part is that I can grab a pack from the coolers and go if I'm on the run.  The owner is extremely friendly and it's impossible to leave without feeling glad you came.

Azxz4IhQ-90pG_et7d39gQ.review_text: Great place and huge selection of beer. The owner was very nice, informative, and just generally great to talk to. Highly recommend stopping in and trying some new beers.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Take flight. Never gets old: youtube.com/watch?v=IAms… Never will get old: $12 for a flight of four beers. Ciders, lights, darks and everything in between. Not being a beer connoisseur had to trust the staff to choose well. They did. Bar seating dominates this otherwise minimally designed new spot. Enthusiastic staff adds an extra energy to the experience. Might become a frequent flyer.

3gvQuIg6QFac7brGFgY9EQ.review_text: Awesome place great atmosphere amazing beer selection and the owner is one cool dude. Come check this place out you will not be disappointed

T4WGSjSrbhzLSCLXYevThw.review_text: great selection of local beers and friendly bartenders!

9Xf2tMbT0sCkBsL-6b3ofA.review_text: Great beer selection, great vibe, nice bartenders. Definitely going back!

FSwqMf3xbo8-vh8zRLuIDQ.review_text: Three times still a charm!!  First visit, came here to watch game #7 of the World Series. The intense then jubilant atmosphere was like nothing I've ever experienced, add to that, friendly knowledgable staff serving 30 locally brewed beers and selected wines.  Champagne was pouring the second Giants took the championship with a 3-2 win, CLASS!  You ask, what can beat that? Well....  2nd visit, 3 pm on a Monday afternoon!  The owner, Tim Lee greeted me warmly.  He was with a sales rep introducing selected wines from a winery in Paso Robles.  Being one of a few patrons in the bar (door just opened), Tim asked if I would like to participate in doing some tasting of the wines the sales rep brought.  An offer I cannot refuse! I love wine!! I got to taste one of their rare Chardonnay they sell on tap, a Cabernet and Sangiovese.  All delicious and tasty!  I hope Liquid Gold will be serving these wines in the future.  3rd visit, Friday night, me and a couple of girlfriends came here to have a few beers and wine before dinner.  They each had 2 beer flights.  A tasting of 4 different beers suggested by the knowledgeable staff depending on your taste.  I had their Cellars 33 Chardonnay on tap.  Loved it!  They even had a bubbly on the menu that night.  All tasty and delicious.    I love the comfort of the bar.  Although I prefer the bar seats, they also offer a cozy couch and a long table with bench seating for bigger groups.  The vibrant atmosphere and decors from a map of San Francisco, "415" area code sign, to the black and white photos along the long wall of the bar gives it a "homey" feeling!    Liquid Gold also offers "to go" beers.  They carry a huge selection of rare and specialty beers in their large refrigerator located in the back of the bar. The 30 beer taps and wine selections are changed constantly so I know I will be back for more tasting.

1vT-1gtksBsx14uKi7UsbQ.review_text: Liquid Gold is a great neighborhood beer bar and shop, located on Hyde. Our crowd of 4 people found an easy spot to settle for a nightcap. The space is basically long and narrow-- the bar itself runs along a majority of the right wall, with a majority of seats along the bar. I don't know if this would be the best spot for a large group-- we were there on a Thursday evening, so the crowd situation was very easy to manage. However, I couldn't imagine a group of 6+ people being able to sit comfortably and converse as a group.  As you would guess, they have a great selection of beers on tap, as well as an extensive fridge of bottled beer. A digital menu shows their offerings, although I found it a bit difficult to read (Perhaps I'm getting old).   We only stayed for one drink, and "last call" was announced around 10:30, so this isn't a late-night spot, but more of a post-dinner spot.  I didn't take tons of time to peruse, but the bottled beer selection was extensive. I can imagine that it serves the Nob/Russian hill clientele very well-- especially after shopping at Trader Joe's across the street.

HrNbhklsdGjYLUJqysTT_A.review_text: Such a good addition to the neighborhood. The servers were very friendly and knowledgable and all the beers on tap were amazing. 30 beers on tap! Will definitely be coming back!

Xl-UAVCm1tRvfQr-5goEUA.review_text: If you want to taste local beer and receive outstanding customer service, this is the best place to be in town! Definitely worth trying!

pI15RINDqpXIk5492xx7PA.review_text: I was a little worried this new, hip spot would be way too crowded on a Saturday night but lucky for us it was lively but not unmanageable. Crossing my fingers it stays a chill spot for locals.  Reasons to like Liquid Gold: Great local beer selection on tap Awesome cider select on tap (Sonoma Cider is my new favorite) Bright, clean decor that welcomes you instantly Dope glasses with the bar's name adorned Take out fridges in the back for when you need to pack a tasty doggie bag

js4wjUqfNu4xJBu27KZKhg.review_text: Finally, it's open!   When I first went to Mikkeller bar, just after it opened, I was incensed at the frou frou glasses beer was served in.  Beer in wine glases...   Age teaches you many things (if you're willing to learn, or else you become one of those horrid old men walking down the street cursing the world, aloud) and one of them is to recognize an Issue, and when to simply accept that something isn't going away.  Frou frou beer glasses aren't going away.  I'm not even going to waste time on the idea.  Liquid Gold is one of those new beer bars with Frou Frou glasses.  Lots of beer to choose from, from several taps behind the bar---although they don't produce any of their own, and I didn't notice any cask capacity, and didn't think to inquire.  I confined myself to IPAs, amazed to discover the range available just in that one style---and one I thought I knew!  The staff, one of which was the owner, was quite friendly, pleasant, and easy to talk to.  And it turned out that one of our bar stool neighbors was an employee of Drakes, and so even more beer knowledge was available for the asking.   All in all a very fine afternoon, and then, as we left, around five, the bar began to fill up.  It's a long, narrow space with high ceilings, bar on one side, bathroom and cooler in the rear.  It's all done in a battle ship gray paint, with a vinyl coated wood bar that looks gray as well.  The cooler is amply stocked with bottles of beer, not limited to that which is on tap...  And that is the one gripe I have with this bar.  Wine is available ONLY by the bottle.  And if you buy wine, or beer by the bottle,  you have to pay a corkage fee as well.  Now why is this?   Corkage fees exist to allow businesses to make some money off of those who insist on bringing their own wine to a restaurant, and to discourage customers from doing so, especially this close to wine country.  Why is a bar that is selling beer, and wine by the bottle, with its own mark-up, also adding a corkage fee?  I don't understand, and I DON'T like it.  I'd take away a star if there wasn't so much beer available on tap, such that I don't see any need to buy a bottle.   If this wasn't a Beer Bar, I'd also be miffed that I can't order wine by the glass, but it is a Beer Bar so expecting wine is something like eschewing Rum at a tiki bar.  So, all is well and I wish this bar good success and hope to make it one of my haunts.

8TD5857n9UWRWxkbI4bT2g.review_text: Wow...what an awesome addition to Nob Hill!  Walking by on Hyde Street today, this place caught my eye... the decor is neat, the ambiance is chill & the owner is a great guy! The bar wasn't open when I was walking by, but the owner Tim was there & I got to talk to him about the bar...he's awesome. I really want to see this new addition to Nob Hill make it, so my husband & I will be sure to check it out this weekend.   Spread the word, I bet this place is going to quickly be a great spot to enjoy beer!! MANY beers...as I think he said they have 30 beers on tap & several more bottled brands. They also had bottles of wine.  (**They had several large tv's for those who want to catch a game)   Let's Welcome Liquid Gold to the neighborhood!  Good Luck!

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: It's a nice neighborhood bar if you're in the area and want to meet someone for the first time off Tinder or OkCupid for a quick drink because it's not too crowded and not too loud. Also there are a lot of bar stools. Is that a weird example? Whatever. There's a pretty great beer selection for how tiny the bar is. It reminds me a bit of The Beer Hall at Polk and Market. Actually it reminds me of that place a lot. It's just far enough from the hustle and bustle of Polk, but just close enough that you can walk to a more crowded bar.  It's unfortunately only open until midnight, but that's just another reason why I think it would be great for a quick date / meet up. I had my Uber driver drop me off here, and he asked me if I was going to Trader Joe's. This was around 8 30 pm on a Saturday. No, sir, I am not. I am going to the bar across the street. But anyway, my point is that you can get drunk and eat snacks across the street at TJs! Yay!

eP66Fwdn1JgL4W-mE1I4aQ.review_text: So my coworkers and I are always looking for a chill spot to drink, get beer bites and try new beers. This place was an amazing recent discovery! They always have 30 beers on tap and they rotate with new ones EVERY DAY.  If that doesn't top it off the finger food, although limited in selection, is damn good and Tim the owner is always happy to recommend a beer that goes well with your selection.  Lastly, the fridge section with micro brews available for purchase will keep my liver busy for a while. Highly recommended!

XZ7gWj4cIbFJOhG03lYY7w.review_text: Liquid Gold has FINALLY opened! It is a great establishment and a great addition to Nob Hill.  Craft beers are the star of the show here. No less than 30 of them are on tap. The kegs are rotated so you will find interesting beers you may never have heard of. The selections are presented on a big TV, which will be easy for them to update when a keg is rotated.  You can get a beer flight for $12 and either pick what you like or have the experts behind the bar cater to your taste profile.  The owner is attempting to keep mainly local brews on draft. I was hoping for a wide variety that may include other regions and I was not disappointed. 2 IPAs blew me away and were better than my current favorite, Alpine Brewing Co.'s "Nelson." They also have a large fridge in the back where they sell lots of high end stuff by the bottle. Here I found a few variations of Dogfish, which hails from Delaware and in my opinion makes some of the best beer in the world.  Watch out City Beer Store, there's a new kid on the block.

wIjp63vMpqWUc8efT7JKqA.review_text: This neighborhood joint is finally open, and I've been happy on both visits. As a genuine bottle shop, you can both drink/taste on premises and buy things you like to take home. They serve lots of regional and local selections, as well as some snacks. Beer flights are available, and you can choose whatever you'd like in yours.

q16FcvZyP5SURJEX8iGcTg.review_text: They have a great selection of craft beer on tap and they have a well stocked fridge so you can purchase drinks to go.  Even though beer is their specialty, they do have wine for those of you who want something else, however the selection isn't as extensive.  Food  - they serve food (from next door) and it's not peanuts, crackers, or pretzels!  We had fried tofu and 2 plates of chicken wings with a side of hot sauce. yum.  Prices - I think their beer and wine is priced fairly well and competitively with other places in the area.  Remember, this isn't a dive bar....

Toz_etQAa0_UR7cHLbWh3g.review_text: I recently moved here from Chicago and found this craft beer bar while shopping at TJ's.  I'm so glad I did because this has become one of my new favorite bars.  They have a great selection of local beers on tap and a bottle shop with all domestic beers towards the rear. I've been here a few time already and the menu is always different.  I'm a huge IPA fan and the salt & pepper chicken wings pair perfectly with it.  Friendly staff too and they let you sample before you buy!

WHB7WXYQ8X_f0_GdRa0Gfg.review_text: Been waiting for this wonderful gem to open and Liquid Gold gets two thumbs up from me. This hip and cool new hot spot offers an attentive and friendly staff along with 30 beers on tap! Featuring many from local breweries, including a small-production of wines and a few non-alcoholic selections for our DDs (Designated Drivers). The twist is that there is also beer available for off-site purchase  The space is balanced with a long L shape bar, cozy couch and communal table.  I've only had the privilege to try four different beers and look forward to come back and check out more local offerings and chatting it up with the locals.

PbmtoKdQ_Td9Ez_WwlEZig.review_text: We have been anxiously awaiting the opening of Liquid Gold.  I have to admit, I thought it might be a bit more pretentious than it turned out to be - I keep forgetting that we are SF, and we are a welcoming culture.  This is a good beer-centric Tap Room that is focusing on diversity and novelty..  30 Brews On-Tap, and a good range of selections.  I like the lay-out of the space.  There is a deep space that has good flow.  There is room for a few people to a good-sized crowd as it get's more popular.  Their service was excellent.  I went off of recommendations for my 4-Beer Flight.  All good.  There is a good vibe here - it is born out of a love for beer and a desire to share a lot of interesting options.  I told the gent I talked to tonight that I LOVE a place that has things that I haven't tried.  They have a lot of interesting stuff, and aim to bring in more.  They also have an extensive Off-Sale Bottle selection.  60-80.  They aim to get unique stuff.  If you liked Beer Hall and Hopwater Distribution, this is of that vein, and this is the new kid.  Oh, and the Bottle Shop on Telegraph too.  Liquid Gold is great.  They have a TON of potential to soon be the best.

0AZHFsD_dJrA6pgVX-HTyg.review_text: Beer flights make me happy, so I am a fan. HOWEVER, there is no food and this place is rather tight fitted. All in all just an A-Ok or me.

NZwGgyT2BVjfWm6h-orOrw.review_text: Been here a few times now with my girlfriend. Great selection of choice local brews, friendly, conversational staff and solid layout. For that, I really want to give five stars but kept it at three due to being priced higher than it should.   Basically all pours are 12 oz. (believe there may be a couple that are 10 oz.). Totally get that--some beers, whether due to rarity, high ABV, ingredients etc. are going to be different prices and different size pours. The issue here is the brews that are more widely produced (and retail for $8 a six-pack) should be a $5 or $6 16 oz. pint and instead are a $7 or $8 12 oz. pour.   End of the world? Absolutely not; especially considering some of the great beers they bring in. But in general, it's priced too high for me to be able to go as much as I do other places of its ilk. Being a brand new place, there's a chance those prices dip down once they establish themselves and build revenue.  At any rate, a very nice addition to the neighborhood and worth checking out.

TjOJqIBxV-K8pRaOt7jbdQ.review_text: Great experience for an out-of-towner looking for the best beer selection in SF. Friendly and informative staff. Beers on tap offered a great variety. The flight was perfect for me.  Even grabbed a few bottles from the cooler in the back on the way out - too much good stuff to pass on.

3zvx-H_FL-XGow0cVnEA6w.review_text: Really enjoyed the friendly service and expansive menu. Comfortable space and good mixed crowd. Definitely will be back.

fGAwlFAd4QBN-m4PJu68vA.review_text: Just a fantastic place to go if you love beer. 30 taps and so many interesting unheard of beers to choose from. A large space and they have a fridge in back with even more beers that you can take to go! One of the very few bars where you can do that in the city. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Their prices are fair - don't come here if you want a cheap and widely available pint. The Hydeout is a few doors down if that's what you're into. Highly recommended.

NTpScaPMhQmVwpvmfg8pjA.review_text: Welcome to the neighborhood!  Thanks Tim, Michael, & Natalie we had a great time last night.  Will be back often, perfect pit stop before or after grocery shopping at Trader Joe's across the street.  30 craft beers on tap, mostly local and constantly rotating.  Also have a great selection of bottles in the back for drinking on the spot or take'em home.  Staff is extremely friendly and very knowledgeable.  Several good TVs for watching sports too  Glad it finally opened, looking forward to swinging by regularly.

yM09Up9aQEJ6uaIxDTORIA.review_text: Very friendly staff. Anxious to educate and allow us the tastings to enjoy.  Was taking a long walk from Union Square for dinner. Good 1/2 way point to enjoy a break and lovin the selection of kind beers, ales, IPA, and the sampler (flights) are a great way to taste a few.
